Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Head of the Wife of an Emperor
Description: Monuments of all materials were discovered under the water of Alexandria's Eastern Harbor. The damaging effect of the sea-water is seen clearly on many monuments. This head of a woman, probably the wife of an emperor, was one of the objects eroded by the sea-water. Some details of the hair are still visible, but the features are now just an effaced silhouette.
